rev.comment: Removed the word 'defunct'. HD DVD is a format, just like VHS, Betamax and MiniDisc

this article is not about [[CH DVD]], it is about HD DVD; please find sources for your other claims that these studios intend to support HD DVD after Toshiba's announcement

No, it is not. The whole of the Indian film groups have stated support for HD-DVD, and that has not changed publicly, Nor has China's intention to use CH-DVD, wholly compatible with HD-DVD. Nor has Ru
This article in its current format represents only the status in the US and Western Europe

"Blu-ray Disc" is the official, agreed upon term
/* HD DVD / Blu-ray disc comparison */ Blu-ray is not a 'former rival' but rather, HD DVD was a rival
I think "discontinued" is a little more neutral. HD-DVD technology is still current, and I think "obsolete" could be a little misleading
move detail into history, fix grammatical tense
added word "obsolete", fully cited, as discussed [[Talk:HD_DVD#Obsolete|here]]

No, it is not obsolete until all development ends and we don't know where all of the companies stand yet. We don't predict future here.

rv. Please check http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:HD_DVD#.22Was.22_or_.22is.22. hd dvd IS optical disc. it WAS competing with BD
it's still out there, see talk
Changed "was" (1st. pp) to "is". Refer to the [[Talk:HD_DVD|discussion page]] for more information.
I misused the word "Betamaxed". I did not know that Betamaxed meant that the failed technology was superior to the competitor. Therefore, I am just going to write that HD DVD lost the format war.

despite the apparently impending end of the format war, HD DVD still exists
